exercises.story: It's time to organize your pantry and cooking steps using lists! You’ll use both unordered and ordered lists to do this.

exercises.title: What is CSS?
exercises.story: Imagine your website is a plain cake — CSS is the frosting and decorations that make it irresistible! CSS (Cascading Style Sheets) controls how your HTML looks, from colors and fonts to layouts and animations. Let’s start by adding some global styles to your webpage to make it visually appealing.
exercises.code:
Welcome to CSS!

Making websites beautiful, one style at a time

Notice how the background and text colors change the whole mood of the page.
exercises.hint: Use the style tag inside <head> to add CSS and try changing colors or fonts!

exercises.title: Styling Lists Like a Pro
exercises.story: Lists organize your content like a neat shelf. But plain bullet points are boring! Let’s spice them up with custom colors, spacing, and styles.
exercises.code:
• Learn HTML basics
  • Master CSS styling
  • Build interactive pages
exercises.hint: Try different list-style-type values and adjust spacing to make lists easier to read.

exercises.title: Perfect Your Navbar
exercises.story: Your navbar is your website’s compass. Let's style it so users can easily navigate while making it visually sleek.
exercises.code: Home About Contact
exercises.hint: Use nav and style a tags with hover effects for interactive navigation.

exercises.story: Websites are like stories broken into chapters. Sections and divisions (<section>, <div>) help organize content — now let's style them!

exercises.title: Colors and Fonts – Making it Your Own
exercises.story: Now that your structure is set, it’s time to customize the look! Pick your favorite colors and fonts to reflect your personality.

My Custom Styled Page

Designing with colors and fonts lets your website tell a story about who you are.
